content: Singaporean actress and singer (born 1974) **Michelle Alicia Saram** (born 12 December 1974) is a [Singaporean](/wiki/Singaporeans) actress, singer and businesswoman. She played the role of Ye Sha in *[Meteor Garden II](/wiki/Meteor_Garden_II)* (2002). ## Early life Her father is a Singaporean of [Indian](/wiki/Indian_Singaporean) descent, and her mother is a [Chinese Singaporean](/wiki/Chinese_Singaporean). Saram was educated at [CHIJ Katong Convent](/wiki/CHIJ_Katong_Convent), [Temasek Junior College](/wiki/Temasek_Junior_College) and [Nanyang Technological University](/wiki/Nanyang_Technological_University) where she majored in Mass Communications. She was awarded the Nanyang Outstanding Young Alumni Award by her *alma mater* in 2006. ## Career In June 1997, Saram joined the entertainment industry after co-starring in an advertisement for One2Free with Hong Kong actor [Aaron Kwok](/wiki/Aaron_Kwok). In May 2000, she released her debut album *Don't play dumb* (別裝傻). Saram joined Singapore television station [MediaCorp](/wiki/MediaCorp) and won the [Star Awards for Top 10 Most Popular Female Artistes](/wiki/Star_Awards_for_Top_10_Most_Popular_Female_Artistes) twice. In 2002, she starred in the Taiwanese drama *[Meteor Garden II](/wiki/Meteor_Garden_II)* as Ye Sha, a girl who accidentally meets Daoming Si (played by [Jerry Yan](/wiki/Jerry_Yan)) in Barcelona. Since then, she is one of the few local actresses who have played lead roles in television dramas from [Singapore](/wiki/Singapore), [Taiwan](/wiki/Taiwan) and [Hong Kong](/wiki/Hong_Kong). Saram subsequently left the entertainment industry to concentrate on running her food and beverage business. Sixteen years later, she collaborated with [Louis Koo](/wiki/Louis_Koo) in the 2017 Hong Kong action film *[Paradox](/wiki/Paradox_(2017_film))*. Shortly after, she focuses again on her food and beverage business. Saram appeared in the film *[Back to the Past](/wiki/Back_to_the_Past_(film))*, a movie that was delayed and unreleased for more than four years and ultimately released in 2025. Later on, she appeared in the 2023 film *[Sunday](/wiki/Sunday_(2023_film))* with Philippine actress Rhen Escaño and Vietnamese actor Ho Thanh Trung. ## Personal life Saram is married to [Chinese Indonesian](/wiki/Chinese_Indonesian) socialite Ajai Lauw-Zecha, son of businessman [Adrian Lauw-Zecha](/wiki/Adrian_Zecha), founder of [Aman Resorts](/wiki/Aman_Resorts) and a scion of the [Lauw-Sim-Zecha family](/wiki/Lauw-Sim-Zecha_family), part of the [Cabang Atas](/wiki/Cabang_Atas) or Chinese gentry of [colonial Indonesia](/wiki/Dutch_East_Indies). After marrying, Saram gradually faded out of the media spotlight. ## Discography - *Don't play dumb* (2000) ## Filmography ### Television series YearTitleRoleNotesRef2000*[At the Threshold of an Era](/wiki/At_the_Threshold_of_an_Era)*Fanny Chun Suk-fan2001*[A Step into the Past](/wiki/A_Step_into_the_Past)*Princess Chiu Sin2002*Fantasy* (星梦情真)Qianqian*[Meteor Garden II](/wiki/Meteor_Garden_II)*Ye Sha2003*[Baby Boom](/wiki/Baby_Boom_(Singaporean_TV_series))*Kristen2004*To Mum With Love* (非一般妈妈)*City of Sky* (天空之城)Xia Rui2006*[Love at 0 °C](/wiki/Love_at_0_%C2%B0C)*Anna2018*Flying Tiger* (飛虎之潛行極戰)Xue Er2020*Who Sells Bricks in Hong Kong* (地產仔) ### Film YearTitleRoleNotesRef1999*[Bullets Over Summer](/wiki/Bullets_Over_Summer)* (爆裂刑警)Yen2017*[Paradox](/wiki/Paradox_(2017_film))*Lee Chung-chi's wifeGuest appearance2023*[Sunday](/wiki/Sunday_(2023_film))*Mrs LeeTBA*[Back to the Past](/wiki/Back_to_the_Past_(film))*Princess Chiu Sin ## Awards and nominations YearCeremonyCategoryNominated workResultRef2001[Star Awards](/wiki/Star_Awards_2001)[Top 10 Most Popular Female Artistes](/wiki/Star_Awards_for_Top_10_Most_Popular_Female_Artistes)—N/aWon2002[Star Awards](/wiki/Star_Awards_2002)[Top 10 Most Popular Female Artistes](/wiki/Star_Awards_for_Top_10_Most_Popular_Female_Artistes)—N/aWon - Michelle Saram at [IMDb](/wiki/IMDb_(identifier)) - Michelle Saram fan site This article about a Singaporean actor is a stub. title: Michelle Saram
